commentary: full, angling across to off stump, and he's creamed that to the long-off boundary! To repeat the words of Tony Greig from 20 years ago, India have won the Test match, India have won the series, and this series has been as much of a fairytale as that one. Let me describe briefly. There was no mid-off, just a straight extra-cover, and Pant brought his wrists into play to drive that full one to the left of the fielder. He kept running, Saini kept running, and I guess no one realised there was no fielder near the ball until it dribbled past the rope
full, wide of leg stump, looks for the one-arm sweep and misses. Good use of the negative line from Hazlewood

now Thakur lobs one straight in the air. This one falls into square leg's hands, though. India still need 3, and they have three wickets left. Back of a length, angling into off stump, and Thakur looks to work it across the line, only manages a leading edge
back of a length, angles into the pads, clips it away to long leg. The fielder didn't have too much room to cover to his left, but they sprint two anyway. Tired legs all over the field now

six to win, goes for the glory hit. Fullish, angling into off stump, looks to slog it over midwicket, and ends up slicing it high over the backward point region. Ends up landing away from both deep point rushing in and cover running to his right. It's Pant's day

short, angling down leg, and Pant swivels to pull and find the gap to the right of long leg. He falls onto his backside while doing so as well. He's played the falling scoop, now he's played the falling pull, and he's nailing everything out of the middle
back and across to defend a length ball spinning in from outside off, meets it right under his eyes

bowled him, you might ask if he needed to play that shot. Not much of a reaction from the Australia players, though, because India only need 10. He's played well, and he misjudges the line, possibly, while trying to reverse-sweep this. A little too close for him, and perhaps there's a bottom edge too, onto the stumps

what a shot. That's tossed up very wide of off stump, and Pant somehow gets a big stretch out and uses his bottom hand brilliantly to whack a sweep out well in front of square, making deep square leg run a long way to his right to stop it
short outside off, keeps low and sneaks under the attempted cut
shot. That's full outside off, and Sundar collapses his back knee to create extra room and play a square drive out to deep point
tossed up wide of off, Pant steps out and reaches out for a sliced drive over the point region
and he produces a jaffa in the middle of all this. Length ball, angling in towards off stump and straightening off the pitch. Slices across it slightly in defence, and the ball beats his outside edge
full, angling into off stump, blocked back to the bowler

all the luck is going India's way now. Shortish, angling into off stump, and he steps across to pull, but it keeps a little low, goes under his bat, and pops up off the thigh pad, between slip and gully
length ball angling across to off stump, steps across and nudges it towards deep backward square leg

full on middle and leg, clipped away into the gap between long leg and deep backward square leg, and that's an easy two on this large outfield. This is smart cricket, and Australia are struggling to set a field to contain India now

fullish, angling across to off stump, presses forward and pushes to the right of short extra-cover. They take the quick single, and get a second when the underarm flick at the keeper's end runs away for overthrows
tossed up fuller, wide of off stump, big stretch out to get his head over the ball and drive to the left of deep cover point

wow, that went like a doosra, probably wholly unintentionally. Back of a length, outside off, and it's the offbreak but it's hit the outside edge of a crack and spun back the other way to miss off stump and beat the keeper
full, wide of off stump, reaches out and slaps it to deep cover point
tossed up wide of off stump, and Pant has absolutely hammered that. A big stretch out, and a powerful sweep along the ground, in front of square

haha, that's just sensational. That's a quick length ball on off stump, and Pant has simply fallen across onto his back knee to scoop it over his shoulder and over the keeper. Outstanding. Rohan Kanhai played the falling sweep, this is the falling scoop
back of a length outside off, left alone
length ball on off stump, and that's either very lucky or very clever, because he's gone hard at the drive, with an open face, and half-deliberately sliced it over the slips cordon

short, and Washington Sundar has just hooked Pat Cummins for six! That's an incredible shot, because it's up near his left shoulder, but he steps across, somehow swivels even though both his feet are off the ground, and hits it right out of the screws. Wow
back of a length, slanting across to off stump, lets it come on and stabs to backward point
length ball on off stump. Looks to drive on the up and it hangs in the air again, briefly, before falling short of mid-off
full on middle and leg, clipped away quietly to long leg
bouncer over leg stump, thinks about hooking but decides just in time to duck out of the way
short, spinning away from off stump, cut past the man at backward point, out to third man
shortish, close to off stump, makes room and chops to deep point
full, angling into leg stump, clipped firmly back to the bowler. Wanted to play that towards mid-on
tossed up fuller now, and Pant plays a flat-bat drive to deep point
sharp turn again. Quicker, just outside off, and Pant is half-forward to defend. Zips past his outside edge
Pant is getting a little edgy here. Loses his shape again while going for a big hit. Tossed up slow outside off, and there's sharp turn and bounce to beat the attempted loft over long-off
sharp short ball, rising steeply over Sundar's back shoulder. Thinks of pulling, decides against it and leaves it
short, at Sundar's ribs again. Hops to ride the bounce, looks to work it away, but can't middle it. Inside-edges into the ground by his feet
full on off stump, driven firmly to mid-off. He wants the single but he's hit it a bit too firmly for that
back of a length on off stump, blocked into the covers
shortish, gets up towards the ribcage, coming at Sundar from his blind spot outside leg stump. Does well to ride the bounce and keep it down into the backward square leg region
super stop from Lyon at backward point. It's short and angling away from off stump, and Sundar jumps to ride the bounce and cuts fiercely. Lyon throws himself to his right and saves four runs
shortish, close to off stump, makes some room and cuts firmly to backward point
short outside off, cut to the left of point, who's come in off the boundary for Sundar

phew, he sliced that in the air but it's fallen short of deep point. Tossed up wide of off stump, and Pant loses his shape looking to hit it over mid-off. Sliced high, but falls short of Green running in from the boundary
short outside off, slapped to the man at short cover
another swing and miss. Tossed up outside off, goes for the big sweep and misses, thanks to some extra turn and bounce. Slip has to dive to hsi right to stop it from running away for byes
back of a length and very wide of off stump, left alone
bouncer, climbing steeply over leg stump, and Sundar keeps his eye on it, drops to his knees, and sways his upper body away from the line

full, angling across to off stump, and that's a super shot. He played this shot so well in the first innings too, and he does it again, pressing forward and leaning into a straight-bat punch to the left of mid-off. Beautiful
bouncer, angling across. Keeps his eye on it and evades it, and it swings late, after it passes the batsman
length ball slanting across to off stump, swinging back slightly. Flicks on the bounce to that leg gully fielder
ooh, Cummins draws another airy drive. Fullish, slanting across, inviting the drive away from the body. Doesn't get his weight forward and the ball hangs briefly in the air but falls short of mid-off
shortish at the hip, tucked away through backward square leg
this was coming. Good idea too, with the line outside off stump and the ball given some air. Brings out the reverse-sweep but can't connect on this occasion
tossed up outside off, and he stretches out to drive to mid-off. The fielder is deep enough to allow the single
very full, a near yorker on off stump, pushed down the ground to long-off
flat and full close to off stump, barely has time to get a stride forward, manages to reach out and jab to short cover
back of a length, a bit wider, left alone
big slog. Lyon dangles a tempter outside off, from around the wicket, and he has a big swing at it and misses
back of a length, angling across to off stump, punched firmly back to the bowler
back of a length, at the hip, hops up and tucks it square on the leg side

gone, caught at short cover, Agarwal is dismissed in the pursuit of quick runs. That wasn't quite up there for the drive, but Agarwal went hard at it, possibly looking to clear the fielder at short cover. Maybe the ball stopped on him, maybe he just didn't time it how he wanted to, but in any case, Matthew Wade times his jump well and takes it over his head

a Cummins special produces a massive caught-behind shout, but the umpire isn't interested... Australia have reviewed here. Back of a length, straightening in the corridor with extra bounce, and Agarwal defends on the hop with an open face. There's nothing on Hotspot as the ball passes the edge, and nothing on Snicko either. Only one review remains for Australia.
shortish on off stump, hops to ride the bounce and defend down the pitch
fullish, angling into middle and off, punched to mid-off
back of a length outside off, quickish, left alone. This is proper cat and mouse
shortish on off stump, cut powerfully to the man at point
full outside off, not quite up there for the drive. Adjusts, after aiming to drive through cover initially, to chop to backward point
a bit of flight, drifts onto leg stump, and Pant stretches out to sweep powerfully to the long leg boundary
flat, angling into the pads, whipped away to the right of deep square leg
back of a length close to off stump, blocked into the covers
full at the stumps, defended to the off side
worked off the hip towards short leg
back of a length at off stump, 136kph, defended to backward point
terrific shot! Full at the stumps, drilled straight down the ground. That was right out of the middle. Actually went straight through Cummins' hands, he will think he could have stopped that
angled into the pads, worked out to deep square leg
round the wicket, back of a length, not too far from dragging this on via the inside edge
good length at the stumps, pushed towards mid-on and that's an excellent run to bring up a brilliant fifty
round the wicket, full and straight, tucked to midwicket
back of a length, gets a thick inside edge that wasn't far from leg stump. Actually, was pretty safe
goes after the full one again, some width outside off, strides forward and sends it through cover...gets hauled in
back of a length outside off, 133kph, happy to let it go through...he's just playing normal cricket at the moment. Hazlewood has overstepped
full outside off, left alone
round the wicket, full at off stump, driven back to the bowler
what a delivery! Good length outside off, angles in then nips away sharply. Nothing Agarwal could do with that
comes round the wicket, good length angle in at the stumps, calmly clipped into midwicket
through the off side! Steps forward and drives a full, wide delivery. Not quite out of the middle but it has the legs. Hardness of the new ball helps
pushed wider outside off, left alone
gets it straight of mid-off this time, comes forward into another full delivery
that was in the slot for Pant, full outside off, drove it nicely but straight to mid-off who is quite wide
huge appeal for lbw! Back of a length and nips back at Agarwal. Hazlewood was convinced, but Paine doesn't go for the review. Ah, he got an inside edge
round the wicket, back of a length, drop-and-run into the off side
great shot! Full outside off, Pant strides forward and nails a cover drive. It's in Pant's hands
full outside leg stump swings further, escapes Paine's dive and that's four bonus runs
good length outside off, defended late and it runs into the gully area
short of a length, down the leg side, Pant misses his flick
this swings late into the stumps, manages to push it straight down the ground
nice shot...full at off stump, gets onto the front foot and punches it straight of mid-on
fuller outside off, nicely delivery, through to Paine
past the edge! Good length outside off, he plays forward and this lifts past the bat

given lbw! Cummins strikes second ball. Pujara has called for the review. A back of a length delivery which nipped back, beat the inside edge and took the back leg. Height the only issue. And it's umpire's call on trimming the bails
nice start, good length outside off, holds the bat inside the line
comes forward and blocks
mighty close leave! Lovely bowling. Goes on with the arm, maybe natural variation, Pant leaves and is nearly bowled. Lyon can't believe it
full and straight, defended
wide outside off, left alone
steps back and drives to point
down the pitch and whips from outside off to the right of mid-on
a slower ball, on off stump, defended
short of a length, angled into the pads, nicely timed through square leg with a flick of wrists
full at the stumps, defended to mid-on...Australia putting together a string of dots
short outside off, he goes for a booming square drive and is beaten over the top edge
full at off stump, 145kph, pushed to mid-on
round the wicket, pushed down the leg side
full outside off, he pushes forward and defends. A maiden
tossed wide outside off, Pant leaves it alone...cat and mouse cricket
full at middle, blocked
full at off stump, defended
wider and he doesn't play
left alone outside off
angled into the pads, tickled away fine for a valuable boundary
big appeal for lbw...gets the full one in, the angle not in Starc's favour. Given not out on the field. Australia talk about the review and decline
round the wicket, short delivery angling in, takes Pujara on the thigh pad
short outside off, whips through a strong square cut to deep point
shorter, he's on the back foot and defends
length ball wide outside off, goes for the cut and takes a bottom edge which scuttles to the keeper
down the pitch...doesn't get it this time, miscues off the toe end down to long-on. He was eyeing the stands
tight leave! Nice bowling. This one is full and goes on straight
touch shorter, pushed back to the bowler
well bowled! Draws him forward and it skims past the outside edge. Extra bounce as well
slides on with arm, pushed into the covers
round the wicket, left alone
short of a length, dropped into the leg side for a quick single
a bouncer which Pant tries to hook but it's well over his head
keeps it short at off stump, 145kph, played into the covers
short on off stump, 145kph, defended
good carry on this one, back of a length outside off, climbs through to Paine as Pant leaves it alone
short of a length at off stump, dropped into the off side. Cover is quickly in
short outside off, gets away with it as Pujara square drives to point
down the pitch again, sweetly clipped from outside off but straight to mid-on
length ball outside off, left alone
full toss, Pujara is down the pitch and has a big swing which goes back to Labuschagne
lovely batting, short outside off, late cuts fine of backward point and it races away. That's his fifty. One of his best
starts with a drag down which is pulled to mid-on
full, wide outside off, Pant not tempted this time. Left alone
nicely down the pitch and flicks this from outside off to mid-on
down the pitch and kicks it away
cut in the air, short of short third man! This took a top edge as Pant flashed hard, got away with it
short outside off, driven very firmly into the covers, pace gets taken of it by a dive from Wade
wide outside off, left alone
angled into the pads, tucked backward of square. Productive over
round the wicket, good length outside off, pushed square into the off side
short of a length at off stump, he's a little cramped for room but is able to play a short-arm jab to midwicket
back of a length at off stump, defended to mid-on
short outside off, slashed away behind point. No half measures against that. Signs?
round the wicket, short outside off, steered through point and there's a sweeper back
there he goes! He's got this one. Down the pitch, picks this up from outside off and drills it over long-on
huge spin outside off! Turned straight to Smith at slip off one of the cracks
punched back to the bowler
steps back to leg and plays this square into the off side, there was turn there
thrusts forward and then kicks this away to short leg
over the wicket, short of a length outside off, defended
back of a length outside off, defended to the covers
length ball outside off, defends this late and it runs to gully
full at off stump, slides off a thick outside edge along the ground to gully
length ball outside off, left alone
round the wicket, back of a length outside off, defended to cover
tucks a straight delivery into square leg
missed stumping! A tough one for Paine. Tossed up outside off, mid-on had been brought up, Pant aimed a huge swing down the ground, was beaten by the turn and the bounce also defeated Paine
keeps it full at off stump, dead-batted on the front foot
stretches forward on off stump and defends
wide outside off, left alone
fuller at middle, defended
good length outside off, defended towards point
a good short ball, over off stump, Pujara sways out of the line
full at off stump, defended
back of a length outside off, left alone
takes on the short ball, was outside off, pulled through square leg. Good running makes three
punched nicely off the back foot into a gap at cover
round the wicket, short of a length, angling in at the stumps, Pant plays this as though it kept low
skips down the pitch and flicks from outside off to mid-on
gets forward and works off the pads to square leg
flicked in the air towards short leg...did it carry? No, not quite
short outside off, rocks back and square cuts to deep cover
stretches well forward on off stump and defends
wide outside off, left alone
full outside off, gets forward and pushes to cover. India yet to score since tea
back of a length, tight to off stump, shoulders arms
short over off stump, 133kph, sways out of the line
back of a length at off stump, hits high on the bat and sends a jolt of pain into Pujara's hand
short of a length outside off, climbs through to the keeper
full at off stump, drives straight but Hazlewood is able to get his right hand on it
prods forward to a full delivery, played to cover. A quiet start to the session
touch shorter, he goes back and pushes to cover
outside off, left alone
fuller, he comes forward and drives carefully to cover
this one slides on, left alone
wide outside off, left alone
back of a length, defended. A maiden to start
fuller, outside off, this moves and keeps going as it reaches Paine
back of a length at off stump, defended to cover
short outside off, allows it to go through
fuller, at off stump, defended
short of a length outside off, aims to withdraw the bat and it takes the bottom edge, into the ground and rolls to slip
length ball close to off stump, presses forward to block into the covers

ooh, beauty. Length ball angling into the corridor and straightening off the seam with extra bounce. Pant gets half-forward to defend, and it zips past his outside edge. Bounced right over off stump too
back of a length, keeps a touch low as it angles in towards off stump. Keeps a close eye on it and defends with a straight bat. Hits low on the bat and rolls to short leg
back of a length, angling into off stump, gets on top of the bounce and defends with soft hands, back down the pitch
length ball angling into off stump. Looks to get on the front foot to defend and the ball nips in off the seam and hits him high on the inside thigh. Ouch
shortish, straightens a touch in the corridor. Jabbed towards gully with an open face
flat, back of a length, spinning into off stump, defended to short midwicket off the back foot
down the track to the flighted ball outside off, and short midwicket dives right to stop his flick
short, wide, slapped away to deep backward point
once again the line is wide of off stump, and Pant is happy to leave. For now
tossed up wide of off stump, exaggerated turn and bounce after Pant decides to leave
tossed up outside off and he's down the track immediately for a sliced drive to the left of deep backward point
short, gets up to head height over the stumps, but Pant is in position quickly, stepping fully back and across to swivel and hook downwards, towards long leg
back of a length, angling into the stumps, gets back and across and defends solidly
full, angling into the stumps, gets forward for a soft-hands push into the covers. He's looking for one but it's too close to the short cover fielder
full, angling into off stump, blocked into the covers
edged and finds the gap. Back of a length, angling into the fourth-stump channel and straightening off the deck. Feels for it, and the edge runs away between second slip and gully
banged in short, angling over the stumps, ducks down low to get under it
flight and dip outside off, two steps out to block it back towards the bowler
flat length ball turning from outside off, defended back down the pitch

down the track to the tossed-up ball on off stump, whips it to the right of the forward square leg fielder and sets off for a risky run. Sent back, wisely, and a better throw might have had him in trouble. Cummins' throw takes the keeper away from the stumps, though
flatter and quicker length ball on off stump, gets his front pad out of the way to block to short midwicket
length ball spinning in towards off stump, defended to short midwicket
down the track to the flighted ball outside off, uses his wrists to work that to forward square leg
full, angling across to off stump, blocked to mid-off
length ball slanting away from off stump, left alone
short again, down leg this time, and Pant can't connect with the hook
short, gets up to around chest height on off stump, and Rishabh Pant gets his 1000th Test run with a pull through square leg
fullish, angling across to off stump, defended to short extra-cover
length ball angling across to off stump, defended into the mid-off region
just a touch short again, turning towards leg stump, and he goes deep in his crease to whip-pull this fine of the man at short fine leg
flat length ball spinning in from outside off, presses forward and clips towards square leg
down the track now, clips this one from middle stump to midwicket
good ball, flight and dip outside off, and it's quick so Pujara can't get out of his crease. Presses forward to defend, and the inside edge runs away to the right of the short leg fielder
a touch short again, the line is straighter, worked away through backward square leg
a touch short, but lots of turn and bounce so Pujara has to defend despite shaping for the back-foot punch through the covers
ooh, dangerous. Length ball slanting away from off stump, and he has an open-faced poke at it. Off the outside half of the bat towards gully

gone, the big man has taken the big wicket. Every time Cummins comes into the attack, you expect something to happen. Short ball, and it follows Rahane as he looks to sway out of the way. Caught in two minds, between leaving and ramping it over the slips, and he ends up caught behind with the ball grazing the face of his bat. He was looking to play his shots, and the risks were always apparent. Similar dismissal to the one at Ranchi against the same bowler back in 2017
back of a length marginally outside off, and Pujara rocks back to punch through cover point. First time he's attacked Cummins by my reckoning
bouncer over off stump, ducks under it
back of a length close to off stump, hops to defend it and then wrings his bottom hand after playing the ball. It hit the bottom of his bat and jarred his hand. Kept a bit low
back of a length, angling into off stump, steps across and tucks it through square midwicket
flight again, and Pujara jumps out to meet it on an off-stump line and looks to whip to mid-on. Lyon dives to his right to intercept
down the track and Lyon bowls quicker and straighter. Lots of turn and bounce, and Pujara stretches out to meet it with pad. This one's turning down leg
tossed up slower, not too far outside off, stretches out and defends with the turn towards short leg

appeal for a catch at short midwicket after Pujara steps out and fails to reach the pitch of the ball. Looks to flick, and I think the ball may have spun past his inside edge and lobbed up off the front pad. Yup, thats what happened.
back of a length close to off stump, punched to the left of mid-off
wham. Rahane is looking to play his shots here, even after getting beaten twice last over. Down the track to a flighted ball on a straightish line, and just carts it with the spin over wide long-on
short on off stump, gets up to shoulder height or thereabouts. Gets right behind it to defend with soft hands
fullish outside off, gets on the front foot to push into the cover point region
beaten again. This time the length is shorter, and he was looking to jab that away, square or behind square, with an open face
ooh, that's a wafty drive from Rahane. Not quite full enough, wide-ish line, and he goes hard at it away from his body. Nips away off the seam to beat him
full, angling into middle stump, clipped wide of mid-on, calling twotwotwo immediately
length ball on off stump, just a hint of shape in maybe, and Rahane stays on the back foot to defend right under his eyes
just a touch short, no more, and Pujara rocks back in a flash and pulls firmly to the right of square leg. Opened up nicely at the hips to make himself room to free his arms
down the track again, gets to the pitch of this and whips to square leg
down the track to a flighted ball close to off stump, clips towards straight midwicket
back of a length outside off, doesn't turn in too sharply, and Rahane can punch to the left of mid-off
flat on off stump, stays back and defends into the on side
turning down the leg side, goes back and clips to backward square leg
length ball on off stump, blocked to short extra-cover
short, rising over off stump. Gets on top of the bounce and drops it into the pitch with the softest of hands
length ball on off stump, defended to short extra-cover
lucky. Looks to sway away from a short ball but leaves the bat pointing up. The ball ricochets off the edge and flies over the slips cordon
length ball close to off stump, gets on the front foot to steer this behind point with an open face

shot. That's driven on the up. Fullish length ball, fifth-stump line, and he drives it through cover point. Slows down as it approaches the boundary with backward point and cover giving chase, but they run four anyway
goes well wide of off stump now, and Pujara can stretch out and kick it away without too much bother
down the track again, gets to the pitch of this off-stump ball and clips to forward square leg
down the track to the tossed-up ball outside off, blocked back towards the bowler
back of a length, spinning in from just outside off, goes back to work it through midwicket
ooh, that's square turn as Rahane makes room to cut. Pitched wide of off stump, and it would have missed leg stump easily. Smacks into his back thigh. Big puff of dust where the ball hit the turf
a touch short, spinning in from wide of off, goes back to stab towards point
back of a length on off stump, defended to short extra-cover

another blow. Banged in short again, and this one jags in sharply from outside off, leaving Pujara with nowhere to go. This hit the front of his helmet as he tried to sway out of the line, the ball just kept following him. He looks okay, but the physio's back on the field to have a look. The blow knocked the stem guard off his helmet
length ball close to off stump, lets it come on and steers behind point with soft hands
full, angling into off stump, blocked to short cover
back of a length, angling into off stump, gets back and across to clip watchfully to short leg
short, angling down leg, gets up above shoulder height but the line allows Rahane to swivel and roll his wrists on top of the bounce to hook it down to the fine leg boundary

down the track, and Lyon goes up in appeal as Pujara plays a defensive jab and is beaten by turn to get hit on the pad. Was a long way down, and impact was just outside off by my reckoning, but what will the umpire say about the batsman's intent? It's been reviewed. No shot offered is what he says. I genuinely can't believe this. Bat does finish behind his pad, but the turn has genuinely beaten him. Ball tracking shows the ball bouncing over the stumps.
nice flight wide of off stump and the ball jumps at Pujara as he steps out. Lifts his bat out of the way and lets it hit his thigh pad
nice length on off stump, good stride forward to block it back to the bowler
tossed up a little wider, steps out and whips it back to the bowler
down the track comes Pujara, whips this from off stump to forward square leg
tossed up on off stump, clipped to the left of mid-on, who's deep enough to allow the single
steep bounce in the corridor, and Pujara lifts his bat high over his head to ensure the ball passes him uneventfully
full on off stump, gets on the front foot to push towards extra-cover
short, angling down leg, steps across and lets it go past his back
full, angling into the stumps, blocked towards mid-on
painful! That's really hurt Pujara. This bounces from short of a length. He drops the bat and is in trouble here. The ball straight into the bottom hand.
past the edge! A lovely delivery. Short of a length, starts to come back and then holds its line off the seam

he's done it! Gill goes for 91. That's lovely bowling from Lyon. A wider line outside off, draws a drive from Gill away from his body, takes the edge and a neat catch at slip by Smith. Superb innings, but is that the moment for Australia?
this one grips, from around off stump, he does well to keep it down in front of short leg
that's a good line, just outside off, hint of turn and defended
nicely timed off the pads as he flicks through square leg, too straight from Lyon
comes down the pitch as he does so often, played back to Lyon
on the pads, pushed through square leg
hint of shape in at the stumps, full length, blocked
full at off stump, 137kph, defended
full and straight, defended
back of a length, straight, worked in front of square on the leg side
left alone, very full outside off, was probably there for the drive
full outside off, played to mid-on
and now it's Pujara's turn, what an over for India, short outside off from over the wicket, upper cut down to third man. 20 runs off the over. Did they just take the Power Surge?
speared down the leg side, don't think went in cleanly for Paine
back over the wicket, short of a length outside leg, tucked to deep square leg

bowler_batsman: Starc to Gill, (no ball) FOUR runs
commentary: another boundary! What batting...Starc goes short again, Gill swivels on a pull through midwicket, keeping it along the ground this time well in front of square. And it's a no-ball
and now down to third man! Short outside off, upper cuts it over the slips/gully area and wide of third man
pulled all the way! Gill takes on the short ball this time, didn't try to keep this one down, and got plenty of it as it flies over deep square leg. Into the 80s
round the wicket, short of a length, punched into midwicket
short, down the leg side, he gets inside the line
full at off stump, 137kph, defended
short of a length, back into position straightaway, works his off his hip to leg gully
ouch! This hammers into Pujara's arm, just above the elbow, as he allows the ball to hit him
back of a length at off stump, 137kph, defended
full at the stumps, worked into the leg side
a bouncer across off stump 141kph, Pujara sways out of the line
short again, defended on the back foot
back over the wicket, short outside off, Pujara throws everything at it with an upper cut over the off side
fuller, outside off, 144kph and left alone
on off stump, back of a length, defended to cover
round the wicket, short of a length in at leg stump, fended backward of square...might have taken glove again
very short, Paine palms it away
short again, over middle and leg, not too far from gloves or body as Gill lets it go over his shoulder
goes for the full one, gets it a bit wrong, pitches beyond the batting crease wide outside off...a few smiles from the Australians
three in a row, ducks underneath the short ball
and again, a bouncer which he ducks
goes underneath a bouncer, 142kph
a bouncer angled over leg stump, comfortably over Pujara's back
short on off stump, stands and plays this down by his feet
put away handsomely, short outside off, takes advantage with a square drive off the back foot through point
short of a length, defended on the back foot
tapped square into the leg side
round the wicket, short over leg stump, this whistles through to Paine as Gill largely pulls out of the aggressive stroke
back of a length, straight, defended.
fuller, at the stumps, flicked to mid-on. Pujara brings up another century
short of a length, 143kph, on the back foot and defends
this pops from back of a length, takes the splice as he defends, bottom hand comes off the bat
short of a length at the body, worked around the corner wide of leg gully and he sprints (sort of) back for the second
a bouncer, ducks underneath
back of a length outside off, opens the face into backward point so he'll be facing Cummins again
short of a length, angled in at leg stump, gets over this one and swivel-pulls to long leg
even shorter this time, outside off, and he opts to leave it alone...what a contest
short again, top edged over deep square! Harris is in quite a way off the boundary and this looped over his head
hammered away! What a stroke...short outside off, Gill latches on and pulls through wide mid-on
round the wicket, short of a length outside off, punched to cover
this one is shorter, he's on the back foot, takes the bottom hand off the bat as he defends
back of a length, straight, defended to mid-on
fuller, at the stumps, gets himself just about forward
back of a length at middle, 140kph, defended to the on side
goes after this short one, not entirely in control as he hooks, gets it down to long leg
very short this time, flies miles over Gill...a very, very late call of no-ball
starts with a bouncer that angles over leg stump

big appeal for caught behind, not given. Australia have a bit of a discussion and decide not to review. It's short and angling down leg, and Pujara looks to ride the bounce and tuck it away fine. Past his bat and brushes him on the side of the body on the way to the keeper
shortish on off stump, rides the bounce and defends into the covers
back of a length on middle stump, defended into the on side
short, gets up to chest height, angling into the body, plays a short-arm pull down to  backward square leg
another bouncer, but this one's outside off and he's uppercut that quite deliberately and hit it all the way over the third man boundary
bouncer over the stumps, ducks and gets under it
length ball angling into the stumps, gets right into position to block it away
ouch, this one hits him on the chest. Hops to ride the bounce, and almost deliberately lets the ball hit him, moving his gloves out of the way
aother bouncer, and this one climbs steeply, above the ducking Pujara and beyond the reach of the jumping Paine behind the stumps
fullish now, on off stump, good stride forward to defend into the short extra-cover region
back of a length, angling into the stumps, and it jags back with extra bounce to hit Pujara's thigh pad after zipping past his hurried defensive jab
takes on the shoulder-high short ball, manages to keep his pull down to deep backward square leg
back of a length, angling into middle stump, rides the bounce and blocks it back to the bowler
shortish outside off, hops again and defends to short cover
short outside off, and this one keeps low. Pujara had both feet off the ground to ride the (expected) bounce and play the square cut, and the ball sneaks under his bat
short, angling into leg stump, pulled to deep backward square leg. Two fielders on that boundary, by the way. One at fine leg as well
shortish, close to off stump, hops up and punches firmly to short cover, who's stationed quite square
bouncer to start, Gill ducks comfortably under it
back of a length outside off, left alone. Really tough over to have gotten through
shortish, gets up to chest height over middle and leg, rides the bounce well and defends with soft hands into the leg side
appeal for caught behind as Pujara gets awkwardly closed off against another short ball. This one hits him on the chest, not far from his gloves
another bouncer from Cummins, angling sharply inwards and following Pujara, and again he gets into a closed-off position while ducking it. This time he's hit on the back
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and defends to midwicket
back of a length on off stump, defended into the off side
flat one turning sharply down leg, left alone
nicely flighted at a quick pace on off stump, skips out and blocks into the on side
flat one turns sharply down the leg side, left alone
nice length on middle and leg, gets forward to clip to midwicket
back of a length on leg stump, goes deep in his crease to work it to backward square leg
tossed up, outside leg again, stretches out and kicks it away
short again, rising steeply over off stump, sways out of the way and keeps his hands down below the ball

yikes, that's smacked him on the helmet. We're beginning to see the first signs of the inconsistent bounce we saw yesterday. Bouncer, and it  doesn't get up quite as high as Pujara expects. It's quick too, and he's got both feet off the ground and is in no position to duck out of the way. Hits the left side of his helmet, towards the back. He looks okay, but the physio will now come out to do a concussion check.
calls twotwotwo as soon as he plays this, and gets it. Length ball angling into the stumps, clipped just wide of mid-on
short, rising ball in the corridor, and that's superbly played. Gets on his toes, rides the bounce, and keeps it down into the point region with soft hands
length ball on off stump, defended to midwicket, meeting the ball right under his eyes
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come on and dabs towards the point region, looking for one, but the backward point fielder moves quickly to deny him
flat length ball on middle and leg, defended towards short leg
back of a length, leg-stumpish, goes back and whips it to deep midwicket
flat length ball on leg stump, goes back and clips firmly to short leg, and the ball bounces up and hits the fielder, Wade, on the chest
flat length ball on leg stump, swept firmly to backward square leg. A couple of feet either side of the man and that was four. They're tempting him to attempt that shot
tossed up on off stump, gets a stride forward to block to mid-off

offers his pad to another ball pitched outside leg. This one's slower, and turns more, beats everyone including the keeper and leg slip. Ah, looks like he did get some pad on it, so dead ball is the signal
full, angling into off stump, good stride forward to block it back to the bowler
back of a length, slightly wider, left alone
length ball, angling in towards off stump, and that's a leave on length. It bounced over the stumps, pretty much, maybe just an inch or two wide of off stump
full, angling into off stump, blocked back towards the bowler
full, angling into off and middle, clipped towards mid-on
bouncer, angling in over the stumps and not rising too steeply. Ducks down, eyes off the ball, and he's hit on the front bicep
flat, speared down on a line just outside leg stump. Padded away again
flat and full, angling across to off stump, gets on the front foot to defend into the off side
back of a length on off stump, goes back to punch to extra-cover
flat on off stump, goes on the back foot to defend it back to the bowler
once again, outside leg, and Gill offers his pad again and the ball turns past it, down the leg side
Flat length ball, pads it away. He can do that easily because this pitched outside leg stump
bouncer over off stump, ducks low and evades it
length ball outside off, left alone
back of a length on middle and off, defended back towards the bowler
full, angling into middle stump, and Gill clips it away wide of mid-on. Slightly overpitched from Hazlewood
back of a length, a little tighter on off stump, gets behind the line to block it back to the bowler
back of a length, close to off stump, punched firmly into the cover region and he brings up an outstanding half-century. He's looked in absolutely no trouble at all today
a bit quicker and straighter, gets out of his crease again to clip around the corner to backward square leg
tossed up slow outside off, steps out and kicks it away. This one pitched too wide to be threatening the stumps, I think, but Lyon belts out an appeal nonetheless
a little wider in line, and a bit quicker too. Gets a stretch forward to defend, and the ball goes on straight. In the end he leaves it alone, pulling his bat out of the way quickly
flighted delivery outside off, steps out and whips to square midwicket. There's a straighter short midwicket too
down the track again, this time it's a little quicker and he has to stretch a bit to squeeze a defensive clip past the bowler and down to long-on
tossed up outside off, and Gill skips out and drives nonchalantly wide of mid-off. Got right up to the pitch and used his wrists beautifully to drive inside-out
length ball outside off, left alone

back of a length close to off stump, defended into the short cover region. There was some extra bounce there, but he adjusted beautifully to get his hands higher and make it look like a straightforward back-foot defensive

full, clipped to the right of mid-on, and they chance a slightly risky single, with the ball going towards the natural hand of the fielder. Pujara dives to make his crease, and he's well home before the direct hit finds its target. Cummins the fielder
length ball close to off stump, gets back and across to block towards mid-off
back of a length outside off, defended to short cover
back of a length on off stump, goes back to punch towards mid-on
steps out again to a nicely tossed-up ball outside off, blocks it back to the bowler
tossed up outside off, gets out of his crease to whip to mid-on, who stops it with a dive to his left
goes back to a fairly full ball this time, outside off, punched back towards mid-on, past the diving bowler
flat length ball on off stump, stays back again and opens up a little to clip to short leg
again on the shorter side, leg-stumpish, goes back and defends down the pitch
back of a length, pitches a little outside off and doesn't turn too much, goes back and punches back to the bowler with a turn of the wrist
bouncer, angling in over leg stump, drops onto his knees and sways his upper body smartly out of the way
back of a length close to off stump, left alone
length ball on off stump, defended towards mid-on
a little fuller, outside off this time, left alone
back of a length on off stump, defended back to the bowler
length ball, not too far outside off, but Pujara judges it well and leaves on length
back of a length again, goes back to punch it towards the non-striker, and Lyon moves across to his right to stop it
back of a length outside off, goes back and jabs towards point
on the back foot again to a length ball on off stump, punched towards mid-off
goes right back to a slightly shorter ball on off stump, defends right under his eyes
down the track, almost gets his pad in the way of a defensive push on an off-stump line, jabbed back to the bowler
flat, turning well down leg, left alone
length ball angling into off stump, defended back to the bowler
bouncer, well outside off and left alone, and the bounce is loopy and slow into the keeper's gloves
fullish, angling into off stump, gets forward for a push to short cover
full, quite wide outside off, left alone
shortish, rising to chest height over off stump, gets on top of the bounce and defends into the on side, does well to keep it down
shot. That's the trademark Gill back-foot punch. I would call that a good-length ball, angling in towards off stump, and he just stands tall and puts it away through cover point
flat on middle stump, goes back and clips to short leg
tossed up slow outside off, inviting the drive. Good stride forward to push to the left of mid-off. Played a fair way in front of his body there
nice length, dip and a bit of turn from outside off, good stretch forward to defend, hits the inside half of the bat
a bit of flight on off stump and Gill jumps out and whips firmly, can't beat midwicket
flatter, goes deep in his crease to clip to midwicket
tossed up on a middle-and-off line, skips out and finds the gap between midwicket and square leg with his clip
length ball close to off stump, blocked to short extra-cover
full, not quite driving length, and Gill plays a good-looking checked drive to short extra-cover
length ball angling into leg stump, defended to wide mid-on
overpitched, a bit of width, gets on the front foot for a wristy drive through square cover. Lyon chases back from point and pulls it back, just about, with a slide and dragback
length ball angling into off stump, defended into the on side
length ball outside off, left alone
takes a stride out of the crease again and defends down the pitch. Nice start from Lyon
comes down the pitch and drives into the off side
pitches around off stump and turns down the leg side
touch quicker on middle and leg, defended
defended back to the bowler
works a straight delivery down to fine leg, a leg slip might have been interested had he been in place
back of a length, angled in at off stump, defended to cover
a bouncer, good line over off stump, Pujara sways out of the line
fuller outside off, comes forward and pushes to cover
left alone outside off, good carry through to Paine
defended to the off side
back of a length outside off, pushed into the covers

this one grips, big appeal for lbw! And Paine has gone for the review. Umpire has decided no shot has been played...umpires' call on hitting leg stump! He'll survive. Not entirely sure about the no-shot offered call there, too. Australia not impressed
full outside off, stretches forward and defends
shorter outside off, a slightly strange-looking pull through midwicket
comes down the pitch then defends
touch shorter, he goes back and works into midwicket
full outside off, brings him forward, defended to cover
length ball at off stump, 144kph, defended to the on side
a shorter delivery, awkward bounce on this one, angled in towards the body, Pujara takes his bottom hand off the bat as he fends it around the corner to leg gully. Hammered into the bottom glove
back of a length outside off, left alone
full, angled into the pads, clipped to deep square leg
fuller, outside off at 143kph, left alone
round the wicket, back of a length outside off, punched square of the wicket
this climbs nicely through to Paine as it's left alone outside off, came back a fraction as well
sweetly punched off the back foot through the covers, neatly played and good timing
length ball just outside off, 137kph, left alone
lovely stroke, gets forward and drives a half volley through the covers...Labuschagne gives chase but can't quite flick it back
fuller, outside off, brings him forward, skewed to mid-on
short of a length outside off, defended with an open face to point
full outside off, 141kph, defended to point
full outside off, comes in with the angle from round the wicket, left alone
full outside off, reaches out to drive, the feet a little stuck, takes a thick inside edge behind square...off the mark from his 22nd ball
wide on the crease, full at off stump, driven firmly to mid-off, diving save from Wade and Pujara gets the dive out to make sure he makes it
full at off stump, 138kph, defended
round the wicket straightaway, full outside off, left alone
outside off, 135kph, left alone
back of a length, this nips back and takes Pujara high on the pads
full at the stumps, 134kph, hint of shape in, defended
sort of a length, straight, worked into midwicket
back of a length outside off, left alone
full at the stumps, pushed to mid-on
full at off stump again, pings out of the middle and Cummins stops it with his right hand. Four maidens in a row for Cummins
good length at off stump, gets forward and defends
a bouncer, 140kph, he ducks underneath
full at middle and off, 142kph, pushed firmly back to the bowler
touch fuller, Gill caught a little back in the crease, takes the bottom hand off the bat as he defends
back of a length at off stump, 139kph, defended
nicely bowled, length ball outside off, this one nips back and isn't too far from off stump as Pujara leaves alone
touch fuller, outside off, nice line and length, left alone
short of a length outside off, left alone
very full, almost a yorker, worked to mid-on
full outside off, driven to the covers
full, angled into the pads, clipped through midwicket
in the channel outside off, left alone
a short ball, ducks underneath...good set from Cummins
angled in at off stump, 139kph, good length and defended to the on side
pushed up even fuller, played into the covers...this pair look a little twitchy between the wickets
full outside off, defended with an open face into the gully...Pujara sets off and is sent back by Gill
back of a length outside off, left alone
short of a length, stays leg side of it and punches firmly to the off side...there was a run there but it's not taken with a bit of confusion between the pair
fuller, at off stump, defended to mid-on
too much width outside off, Gill plays a slashing square cut, flies high over backward point
full, angling into middle and leg, clipped off the pads behind square
full outside off, left alone
good length, nips back off the seam, brings a strangled shout from the slips but it's done too much and is probably high as well
short of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
good length outside off, 140kph, left alone
this comes back! Starts outside off and jags in off stump, but carries well over the stumps
in the same spot outside off, Pujara raises the bat out of the line

edged, gone! It's Cummins, as it is so often. In the channel just outside off, brings him forward, it's a healthy outside edge, Paine takes a good diving catch in front of first slip. Rohit may consider he could have left that

bowler_batsman: Cummins to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: full at off stump, 139kph, defended to mid-on
good length, angling in at off stump, gets a small stride forward and defends
that's the length, full outside off, well watched by Gill as he shoulders arms and Paine takes it on the rise above his head
angled in at the stumps, played to the on side...needs to bring him onto the front foot
back of a length at off stump, defended
good length at off stump, Gill has looked pretty comfortable defending those off the back foot
full at off stump, played with a straight bat and it runs into midwicket
and again, defended with a high elbow, back down the pitch
short of a length, stays on the back foot and defends down the pitch
on off stump, defended on the back foot
back of a length, straight, defended to the on side
what a delivery! That's unplayable. Full length, angling in at off stump, then moves away late to beat the edge
full at off stump, Gill gets a little squared up as he defends

bowler_batsman: Hazlewood to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: full outside off, defended

bowler_batsman: Hazlewood to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: well bowled, goes fuller at the stumps, Rohit caught on the crease, takes him high on the back leg
dropped in short, he goes after it with a pull well in front of square...outfield a touch slow after the heavy rain
full outside off, driven to mid-off...no significant movement in the air yet today, although that isn't the main weapon for Hazlewood and Cummins
fuller at off stump, 135kph, defended on the front foot to cover
back of a length, straight, defended

bowler_batsman: Cummins to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: big seam movement this time, nips back into Rohit and takes him high on the pads
neatly played, gets onto the back foot to a short-of-a-length delivery and punches wide of mid-off
fuller, at middle, 140kph, defended back to the bowler
good length just outside off, brings him forward as he defends to cover
full outside off, a very sweet drive finds mid-off
length ball, straight, tucked into the leg side with a closed face

bowler_batsman: Hazlewood to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: shorter, outside off, played to the on side from the back foot
full at the stumps, clipped through square leg without perfect timing
outside off, perhaps a hint of movement, playing off the back foot a little way from his body, runs this through gully
back of a length outside off, punched firmly to the covers
in the channel outside off, steered towards backward point and after some hesitancy they get through for the single

bowler_batsman: Hazlewood to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: length ball at off stump, 131kph, played to the on side
this may have kept a fraction low, back of a length, nips back towards the stumps, Rohit is able to work into midwicket

bowler_batsman: Cummins to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: good length, angling in at off stump, defended square into the off side

bowler_batsman: Cummins to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: back of a length at middle and off, 140kph, defended...perhaps just needs to go a touch fuller with the new ball

bowler_batsman: Cummins to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: touch fuller, Rohit stays reasonably deep in the crease as he defends

bowler_batsman: Cummins to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: outside off, back of a length at 138kph, defended

bowler_batsman: Cummins to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: short of a length at off stump, hops behind the line and works to short leg
back of a length, straight, pushed firmly to mid-on
that's a good one, in the channel outside off, this zips through to Paine as Gill pulls the bat inside the line
on middle, not quite full enough, defended to the on side
back of a length at off stump, 132kph, defended
full outside off, some nice shape away, left alone
short of a length, straight, defended

bowler_batsman: Starc to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: full at middle, defended

bowler_batsman: Starc to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
commentary: full outside off, Rohit gets onto the front foot and drives this perfectly through the covers

bowler_batsman: Starc to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: good length, angled across outside off, left alone...can he get one to shape back?

bowler_batsman: Starc to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: full, wide outside off at 140kph, left alone

bowler_batsman: Starc to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: short again, 138kph, on the back foot and plays it down into the crease...Starc not thrilled by his take-off area

bowler_batsman: Starc to Rohit Sharma, no run
commentary: short of a length, defended down by his feet, Starc immediately turns and look at the crease
